intro: Hieracium divisum grex onosmotrichum, commonly known as the Onosmotrichum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a robust stem with rough, hairy surfaces and basal leaves that are deeply lobed. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. This species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
